intro: Pseuduvaria coriacea, commonly known as the rough pseuduvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and rough, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
